revision.text:
{{spoiler}} [[File:ZXY&Moebius.png|thumb|240px|The Consuls]] The '''Consuls''' (Japanese: {{Lang|jp|執政官}}, ''Shisseikan'') are an organization in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.
== Overview == The Consuls are a mysterious group exerting control over both [[Keves]] and [[Agnus]]. They always cover their face with masks.<ref>https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1539778679001079808</ref> In battle, they can assume a form called [[Moebius]], which is over 5m tall and bears a resemblance to an [[Ouroboros]].<ref>https://www.nintendo.co.jp/switch/az3ha/story/index.html</ref> According to [[Taion]], their role is to convey the orders of the [[Masked Queen|queens]] to the [[Colony|colonies]] and handle admin and decision-making<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hoHvpS2x8us</ref>, however they also exert control over both [[nation]]s.<ref name=":0" /> They attack [[Noah]] and the others to eliminate Ouroboros.<ref name=":0">https://www.nintendo.co.jp/switch/az3ha/assets/img/story/img_diagram.png</ref> Their master is [[Z]], who offers them immortality, power, and permission to entertain themselves as they see fit in exchange for ensuring that the state of [[Aionios]] is never allowed to change. Although they cannot age or die of natural causes, they must consume the life energy of other beings to survive. They also have one letter names which for the ones who became Consuls is the first letter of their old name - the only exception is Triton, who chose to be known as that instead of T despite other members of the Consuls reminding him that his name is T.
[[File:Moebius Icon.png|thumb|The Moebius Symbol]] They consist primarily of dead individuals who had showed an interest in ensuring the continuation of the war while they were alive in belief that it is the best existence possible, freedom from weakness, or enjoyment of the violence as a form of entertainment; the only exceptions are [[X]], [[Y]], and Z, who are noted as having been "born" Moebius. All of the aforementioned individuals were selected to become Consuls solely because Z found it amusing to do so.
An infinity symbol features in their designs in several places. It shows up in their eyes at times, it features prominently on [[D]] and [[Joran|J]]'s [[Moebius D & J|Interlinked Moebius]], the Moebius forms of the other Consuls, and on N's sword. {{clr}}
== Members == * [[B]] * [[Crys|C (Crys)]] * [[D|D (Dirk)]] * [[E]] * [[F]] * [[G]] * [[H]] * [[Irma|I (Irma)]] * [[Joran|J (Joran)]] * [[K]] * [[L]] * [[M|M (Mio)]] * [[N|N (Noah)]] * [[O]] * [[P]] * [[Q]] * [[Q (FR)]] * [[R]] * [[R (FR)]] * [[Shania|S (Shania)]] * [[Triton|T (Triton)]] * [[U]] * [[V]] * [[W]] * [[W (FR)]] * [[X]] * [[Y]] * [[Z]] (Leader)
== Trivia == * There is at least one Consul associated with every letter of the English alphabet except the letter A. Since there are 26 consuls for the 26 letters of the alphabet, it's implied that there ''is'' (or at least, ''was'') a Consul A. However, this Consul never seen in game. The exact amount is only mentioned in Consul I's files. While a character called [[A]] appears as a major character in {{XC3FR|sublink}}, they are not a Consul, as Z had no involvement with their creation. {{XC3FR|sub}} provides evidence against this however, as there are completely different versions of Consuls Q, R, and W, who have the appearances of E, H, and B showing that the names and helmets of Consuls are reusable. * B, E, F, G, H, L, O, P, Q, R, U, V, and W are the only consuls who were never seen with their masks off in the game. However, the artbook reveals both E and F without their masks. S and Z are the only consuls never seen with their masks on. C, F, M, N, T, and Z are the only consuls who were never seen in their Moebius form. * The Consuls are similar in role to the [[w:c:xenosaga:Testaments|Testaments]] from ''[[w:c:xenosaga:Xenosaga|Xenosaga]]'', both are a group of dead individuals who are revived by their respective [[w:c:xenosaga:Wilhelm|leaders]], whom they serve, and keep the world in a [[w:c:xenosaga:Eternal Recurrence|perpetual cycle]]. Their designs bear variations of a resemblance to the style of outfit worn by said organization as well as [[w:c:xenosaga:Grahf|Grahf]] from ''[[w:c:xenosaga:Xenogears|Xenogears]]''. Although the one that looks the most like Grahf is D.

revision.text: {{Infobox XC3 Status | title = Counter Heal | caption = Heal HP when hit, for a set no. of hits. | image = XC3 Delayed Healing.png | type = Buff | base-duration = 15.0s | max-duration = 30.0s | rng-applicable = Yes | effect-title-1 = Base Healing Amount | effect-value-1 = 5% of character's max HP | effect-title-2 = Base # of Activations | effect-value-2 = 3 }} '''Counter Heal''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}}. It heals the affected character whenever they get hit, for a set amount of times, after which the buff is removed. ==Distribution== ===Arts=== *[[Mirror Trap]] ([[Strategos]]) [[Category:XC3 Status]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |category = Unique Monster |name = Crafty Anskey |image = XC3 Crafty Anskey.png |caption = Crafty Anskey |type = [[Wisp]] |level = 54 |area = [[Elaice Highway]] ([[Yunnae's Rise]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = 1,232 |cp = 250 |sp = 5 |gold = 1,212 |hp = 1,517,500 |strength = 788 |healing = 402 |ether = |dexterity = 191 |agility = 186 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 0% |critrate = 15% |guardrate = 0% }} '''Crafty Anskey''' is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] in {{XC3}}. It is a member of the [[Wisp]] family, and can be found at level 54 at [[Yunnae's Rise]] at [[Elaice Highway]]. The Revenge Impetus [[Skill (XC3)|Skill]] can be earned by the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] for defeating this monster. == Resistances == {{XC3 Resistances |break = 50% |physdebuff = 50% |etherdebuff = 70% |knockback = 50% |blowdown = 50%}} {{clr}} == Gallery == <gallery> Crafty anskey location.png Crafty anskey.png </gallery>

{{for|the enemy in {{XC2|-}}|Crane Serprond (XC2)}} {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Crane Serprond |image = |caption = Crane Serprond |category = Minor Enemy |type = [[Serprond]] |level = ? |area = [[Erythia Sea]] |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Crane Serpronds''' are Minor Enemies in {{XC3}}. They are members of the [[Serprond]] family, and can be found at level ? in [[Erythia Sea]]. {{clr}} == Challenge Battle Mode == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Crane Serprond |image = |caption = Crane Serprond |type = [[Serprond]] |movement = |tab1 = Stage 20 |area = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level = 75 |detection = |spawntime = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn = No |hp = 1,064,700 |strength = 1,434 |healing = 1,140 |dexterity = 331 |agility = 189 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 25% |critrate = 5% |guardrate = 0% |tab2 = Stage 90 |area2 = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category2 = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level2 = 110 |detection2 = |spawntime2 = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn2 = No |hp2 = 20,971,580 |strength2 = 10,563 |healing2 = 17,980 |dexterity2 = 569 |agility2 = 320 |physdef2 = 0% |ethdef2 = 25% |critrate2 = 5% |guardrate2 = 0% }} A Crane Serprond is fought at level 75 alongside a [[Zeoth Serprond (XC3)|Zeoth Serprond]] at Stage 20 of the [[Archsage's Gauntlet]] [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge]] ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]''. Another Crane Serprond is fought at level 110 alongside a [[Grilan Moglum]] and a [[Broon Moglum]] at Stage 90 of Archsage's Gauntlet Challenge ''Gauntlet: Pro''. === Skills === The Crane Serpronds have the following skill: *Deals 10% less damage but takes 30% less damage. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 70% |knockback = 90% |blowdown = 90% |physdebuff = 70% |etherdebuff = 70% }} === Enraged === {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:55%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |style="text-align:left;"|Boosts damage dealt by 50%.
Boosts Art recharge speed by 50%. |} {{clr}} === Arts === {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:120%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Ether |One Target |1 |180% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to [[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] and [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] during Art. |- |'''Mega Wave''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |1 |200% |Blowdown |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |- |'''Jet Stream''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |1 |165% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |- |'''Lightning Storm''' |Ether |AOE around User |3 |225% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |} == In {{XC3FR|sub}} == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Crane Serprond |image = |caption = Crane Serprond |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Serprond]] |level = 41 |area = [[The Ragmos Desolation]] ([[Raguel Lake]]) |spawntime = During Thunderstorms |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = }} '''Crane Serpronds''' are Normal Enemies in {{XC3FR}}. They are members of the [[Serprond]] family, and can be found at level 41 in [[Raguel Lake]] at [[The Ragmos Desolation]] during Thunderstorms. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Serpronds]] [[Category:XC3 Level 71-75 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Level 100+ Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Minor Enemies]] [[Category:The Ragmos Desolation Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Serpronds]] [[Category:XC3FR Level 41-45 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Weather Dependent Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing drops]]
